p:
After fermentation, decreases in benzaldehyde but increases in benzeneacetaldehyde were observed, as shown in Fig.Â 4A. A decline in benzaldehyde was also found in cheese agar when it was fermented with Y. lipolytica CBS 2075
40 . The boosted content of benzeneacetaldehyde might have resulted from the bioconversion of phenylalanine due to the catabolism of Y. lipolytica.
